messages.message: @Travis, in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/60627) I changed the use of `DataEditor` to `Spreadsheet`, which I noted is essentially just a pollen wrapper for `DataEditor`. This change was also necessary since we have some custom additional logic for rendering such a component inside a modal (can read this (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1722460700502479) thread). I noticed that in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/60699/files) we reverted the use back to `DataEditor` — I just wanted to clarify why this change was necessary. It’s unfortunately breaking our use case for solution accuracy so want to understand if/where the divergence between `DataEditor` and `Spreadsheet` is

I had changed this back so I could use an upgraded version of DataEditor. Let me check on the version and if I absolutely still need it. If anything we could update the version in Pollen and then Spreadsheet can be used again
it looks like I actually didn’t end up using the updated version, so you can switch back to using `Spreadsheet` without any trouble.
